posts.title: Long shot - My Dad's dying of cancer.  Would some of you say this prayer?
posts.content:
Dear Lord Jesus Christ,

You are the sign of God’s love active in the world. In your humanity, you became like us in all things but sin. Thus, you knew firsthand the reality of suffering and pain, of uncertainty and the fear of death. In the Garden of Gethsemane, you prayed for release from the burden (as you also did as you hung on the cross) but also gave yourself over to fulfillment of your Father’s will.

Teach us to live in the same spirit of hope-filled resolve. As I seek healing and recovery for Elliot Linne's cancer, I also recognize that his condition is precarious and the final outcome is unknown.

I am grateful for all who continue to assist him in his journey, medically, emotionally, and spiritually.

May you boost his spirits, sustain him with your promise of eternal life, and if it is your will, heal him so that he might serve you and your people in the years ahead.

Amen.

--Rev. Edward A. (Monk) Malloy, C.S.C. (Modified) President Emeritus 16th President of the University of Notre Dame

Thanks pedes, God Bless.

UPDATE - Thank you all. We are appreciative. Today's been tough. We got off a difficult call with his hosptal. They say there's nothing more that can be done for him and want him to go to hospice care. He has a stoma from a larynectomy last year (throat cancer from 50 years of smoking) and it is a site of recurring infections which they cannot control, and the tumor's have spread to that hole and keep bleeding, making too many complications to try chemo.

Its very hard because when I look at my Dad, he doesn't look like he's dying--yet--he looks like he is ready and willing to just walk out of the hospital. He's still hardy and full of life force. But there's nothing more to try apparently. I got to say my goodbyes to him over a video call today. While I have no regrets about my relationship with my Dad, there's no unfinished business or hard feelings, its still hard to deal with the finality.

My father is in Chicago. I am in WA state, I am a brand new father. We have a baby girl born late Oct this year. (She was 2 weeks old when we celebrated Trump's victory!) and this makes it difficult to travel out to Chicago to do much. I am will to try though. I am open to looking into the ivermectin and Fenbendzole. However, I faced this problem 3 years ago when my Dad nearly died of covid. Its a miracle that he survived. He was in a hospital that disputed ivermectin, that refused to administer it, because "its not a recommended treatment" (but they gave him remdesivir instead). I do not credit his recovery at all to that miserable excuse for a hospital. he's not at the same place now, but I have no faith in the medical community since then and I have family who argue with me on all my "alternative" medical advice (even though we were absolutely right about Ivermectin).

Any advice on how we might get alternative treatments into him are welcome too.

posts.title: ANOTHER DEM HOAX EXPOSED — Dems were mad last night that Elon killed the funding bill which had money for kids with cancer. Turns out, GOP House passed it as a stand-alone bill earlier and CUCK SCHUMER AND DEMS BLOCKED IT IN THE SENATE.
posts.author: maltese-poodle

twitter.content:
You know that $190M of funding for pediatric cancer research that Democrats have spent the last day on their high horse about with the CR?

Turns out it passed the Republican led House as a stand-alone bill last March but went nowhere in Chuck Schumer's Senate.
